article_title: Edward Prescott and Lee Ohanian: U.S. Productivity Growth Has Taken a Dive
article_text:
In his State of the Union address last Tuesday, and in speeches across the country since, President Obama has emphasized that Washington needs to "do more to help the entrepreneurs and small business owners who create most new jobs in America." He's right. And he should start by rethinking his own administration's policies.

The remarkable productivity growth that has enabled the U.S. to become the wealthiest country on earth has slowed considerably in recent years. The productivity of U.S. workers has grown at an...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Edward Prescott and Lee Ohanian write that productivity growth has averaged about 1.1% since 2011, less than half the historical rate since 1948. They explain how to increase it.
twitter.title: U.S. Productivity Growth Has Taken a Dive
